docs.summary: Currencies that can be used for payments.
description: You can accept payments in your Wix store in different currencies. You can set up a number of currencies for your store and convert between them.
The exchange rates used to convert between currencies are provided by [XE](https://www.xe.com/company/) and updated on an hourly basis and include the timestamp when they were set.

docs.summary: Returns conversion rates and converts amounts.
description: Use the currency converter to get currency conversion rates for any pair of supported currencies.
The  rates are set once a day and the timestamp for each rate is returned together with the  conversion rate.
You can also convert an array of amounts from one currency to another.

docs.summary: Returns currencies that you want to support on your site.
description: You can set the currencies that you want your site to support.
The currency codes used must exist in the array returned by the [`getAllCurrencies()`](#currencies.getAllCurrencies) function.

notes:
For the SiteSettings functions to work, your site must contain a store page and the you need to add the [currency conversion element](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-and-setting-up-a-currency-converter-in-wix-stores) to the page.
You can hide or collapse the currency conversion element so that it does not display.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - The list of all supported currencies.

docs.summary: Gets the list of all supported currencies that can be used for payments.
description: The `getAllCurrencies()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an array of currencies.
The array lists all of the supported currency codes and their symbols that can be used for payments on Wix sites.

examples.title: Return a list of all supported currencies.

notes:
This function is different from [`siteSetting.getCurrencies()`](#siteSettings.getCurrencies) in that this function gets the complete list of all of the currencies that can are supported on Wix sites. 
The [`siteSetting.getCurrencies()`](#siteSettings.getCurrencies) function gets only the currencies that have been set for use in this site using the [`siteSetting.setCurrencies()`](#siteSettings.setCurrencies) function.
By using this object you agree to XE's [Terms of Use.](https://www.xe.com/en/legal/dfs.php)
